DrawnMap - Class in View
DrawnMap is the panel where the map is drawn.
DrawnMap(Controller) - Constructor for class View.DrawnMap
Class constructor.
DrawnMap.MouseState - Class in View
MouseState is MouseListener class that defines new classes for the methods used A MouseState is composed of: A boolean that indicates if the the mouse is pressed A boolean that indicates if the the mouse is released A float that indicate the x-axis position of the mouse on the screen A float that indicate the y-axis position of the mouse on the screen A boolean that indicates if a segment is selected A boolean that indicates if an intersection is selected A boolean that indicates if we are performing a zoom MouseState is created to be an attribute of the DrawnMap class, and serve as it's own MouseListener.
drawOver(Graphics) - Method in class View.GraphicalIntersection
Draws a number that indicates the visiting order of the stop in a tour.
drawPath(Graphics) - Method in class View.GraphicalSegment
Sources : https://stackoverflow.com/questions/2027613/how-to-draw-a-directed-arrow-line-in-java When a segment is used on a tour, the segment is drawn differently to show the path.
drawStopRequest(Graphics, String, Color) - Method in class View.GraphicalIntersection
Represents graphically a particular intersection which is a stop in a tour.
